thread.title: Rare 'fire rainbow' is spotted in Singapore | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Rare 'fire rainbow' is spotted in Singapore | Daily Mail Online

author: Kelly Mclaughlin For Mailonline
title: Rare 'fire rainbow' is spotted in Singapore | Daily Mail Online
text: Extremely rare 'fire rainbow' that makes the sky look like it's burning is spotted in Singapore The 'fire rainbow' formed behind a cloud on Monday afternoon in North-East District, Singapore It was so bright that onlookers even mistook it at first for a UFO as it loomed ominously across the skyline Fire rainbows are a rare occurrence caused by light bursting through cirrus clouds at high altitude The sunlight is reflected through the ice-crystal clouds into a bright prism of colours Published: 09:48 GMT, 21 February 2017 | Updated: 10:12 GMT, 21 February 2017 18 shares
